caption:
This photograph captures a bustling outdoor shopping scene, likely a sidewalk sale or street market. The setting appears to be in front of a brick building, possibly a store, under bright, sunny weather conditions. 

In the foreground, several clothing racks are arranged, filled with a variety of garments. These racks display men's swimwear priced at $4.95, boys' sweatshirts starting from $3.90, Viking rain jackets, football and baseball jerseys, and other items. Handwritten signs with pricing are prominently displayed above the clothing.

Three individuals are interacting with the merchandise. On the left, a person wearing a red tank top with "NICK'S" printed on it, shorts, high socks, and a visor is examining an article of clothing. In the center, another individual wearing a similar "NICK'S" tank top and a hat is browsing through the rack focused on men's swimwear. To the right, a younger person in a green t-shirt is looking at clothes on another rack.

The scene conveys a casual, leisurely shopping atmosphere typical of neighborhood street sales. The bright colors of the clothing, combined with the clear outdoor lighting, give the photograph a vibrant, lively feel. The diversity of clothing suggests a focus on sports and casual wear.
title: People looking over bargains among merchandise placed in Minnesota street and on side-walks by merchants in New Ulm Minnesota, during their annual crazy days sale.  The bulk of the business districts stores have been revitalized with community support.  New ulm is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe
